intro: Luerssenia cyminum, commonly known as the Persian cumin or Persian coriander, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It features slender, branched stems and small, oval-shaped leaves that are often aromatic. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. Its seeds, similar in appearance to cumin, are used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Luerssenia cyminum thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, making it a hardy plant in temperate climates.
